intro: Erysimum autareticum, commonly known as the Spanish wallflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and northern Africa. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows to a height of 30–60 centimeters. The plant features bright yellow or orange flowers that bloom in late spring to early summer. Its leaves are lance-shaped and slightly hairy, while its stems are often branched and covered in fine pubescence. Erysimum autareticum thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and borders.
